title: What the frickity frack am I supposed to do about tanks

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
The fact is, lethality just isnt cutting it for me. It seems as if most games come down to who has the better tanks. Tanks are now not only taking almost no damage, but are also dealing considerable damage, being great frontlines, and not letting you reach backlines because of hard cc, meaning you can't get on their squishies and can't do anything about the tanks before the carries kill you. In the picture provided, mundo deals % hp damage, facetanks, and has more than enough cc to outrun/chase any of us, since he outdamages us thanks to tankiness. Nunu does the same thing, but has a slow on his E that may as well be a root, along with providing movement and attack speed, and has a free heal in his Q. 

And It's really driving me nuts. What am I supposed to do when tanks deal the most damage in the game, have the most cc in the game, and take the most damage in the game?

replies.body: why do you not have a {{item:3035}} item or {{item:3071}} no wonder you do no damage to tanks

How about actually take some tank burning items and not expect to blow up a tank in 1 rotation?

problem is you

Im not expecting to blow them up, and I did buy a decent amount of lethality in Ghostblade, Edge of night and masteries. The problem is no one can reach the backline because they do so much damage and have so much cc despite being insanely tanky
Sneak around them instead of running through them. All that out of combat movement speed and kha's invisibility is wasted if you're just going to dive head first into the frontline.

I don't dive head first..I'm not an idiot

Okay for example, I use my evolved R to go from a bush into the enemy team's backline, Caitlyn is isolated. I burst her for most of her hp, but she bounces away, followed by Nunu and Mundo rushing back to chain cc me down. Invis isn't really useful when you're slowed to the point of being rooted.

So just jump away. If Nunu and Mundo are already on you, then either Cait was too close or you just weren't sneaky enough.

Cait is low and you've pulled away the tanks. You've done your job. You're team now has a free engage or some opportunity to push some objective.

Meanwhile there have been threads today saying lethality needs to be nerfed because it is too effective against tanks.

Take a long look at how tanks deal their damage, that might give you a clue as to why they get high damage numbers without actually being able to 1v1 a well played carry.
Asking because you seem to be the only one not insulting me, and I'd appreciate genuine advice.
assassins arent meant to melt or 1 shot tanks at all
